Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; interior: glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of water birds (only the head of the left is missing; added red on wing; of the bird to right part of body, leg, and tail feathers remain; red on wing); below, broad black band with narrow red bands at top and bottom.
Producer name: Attributed to the Manner of: Lydos
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 125, pl. XXXVIII, no. 351.6)
CVA Boston II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum USA, Fasc. 19, Museum of Fine Arts, Boston (p. 3, pl. 108, no. 1)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 231, no. 172)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0959)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4749 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
